property.label: Device Name
property.description: Device name

property.label: Device description
property.description: Describes the device

property.label: Device category
property.description: Device category

property.label: Can this device be edited through ui?
property.description: If the value is false it means that there is something about the configuration of this device that makes it not possible to be changed through UI. The value of this property can be false only of it is hand edited in CMS.xml

property.label: Enable
property.description: If enabled, the Device will establish connection with the device. If disabled, the device will close existing connection.

property.label: The ID of the ThinEdge platform to be deployed to.
property.description: If the value is not null, it indicates the ID of the ThinEdge platform.

entity.label: Printer Configuration
entity.description: Just a hack to allow UI to desplay this considered RF device as a non RF device

property.label: Device type
property.description: Selects specific model of the device.

property.description: Device EPC

property.description: Display Name

property.description: Selects specific model of the device.

property.description: Selects specific model of the device.

property.description: Device EPC

property.label: Name used for logging
property.description: Display Name

property.label: Default Time-Out
property.description: Default command time-out value is used unless command specific time-out value defined.

property.label: Device type
property.description: Selects specific model of the device.

property.label: Supports Notification
property.description: True if the device can send notification messages

property.label: Device Id
property.description: Device Id

property.label: Name used for logging
property.description: Display Name

property.label: Default Time-Out
property.description: Default command time-out value is used unless command specific time-out value defined.

property.label: Device Real Name
property.description: Device Real Name

property.label: Device type
property.description: Selects specific model of the device.

property.label: Maximum number of antennas
property.description: Maximum number of antennas for a DK Agent device

property.label: Device Model
property.description: The actual device type modelled by this DK Agent Device

property.label: Digital Input Ports
property.description: Digital Input Ports in the device

property.label: Digital Output Ports
property.description: Digital Output Ports in the device

property.label: Channel Name
property.description: Channel Name

property.label: Data Channel Category
property.description: Data Channel Category

property.label: Socket Time Out
property.description: SocketTimeOut is added to command time-out and is set prior to read() call on the Socket, which will block for only this amount of time. Integer 0 - 1000000; default 2000.

property.label: Send Buffer Size
property.description: Integer 100 - 60000; default 2000. Send biffer size option is used by the platforms networking code as a hint for the size to set the underlying network I/O.

property.label: Receive Buffer Size
property.description: Integer 100 - 60000; default 2000. Size of the receive buffer used for input. Increasing the receive buffer size can increase the performance of network I/O for high-volume connection, while decreasing it can help reduce the backlog of incoming data.

property.label: Reuse Address
property.description: When a TCP connection is closed the connection may remain in a timeout state for a period of time after the connection is closed. Enabling ReuseAddress prior to binding the socket using bind(SocketAddress) allows the socket to be bound even though a previous connection is in a timeout state.

property.label: Frame Receive Buffer Size
property.description: Integer 0 - 10000; default 300. Size of the receive buffer used to hold unclaimed frames. If size exceeded all frames are removed from the buffer.

property.label: Data Channel Type
property.description: Data Channel Type

property.label: Port number
property.description: Notification channel port number.

property.label: Port number
property.description: IP Port number. If the device is Alien, port number has to be 23. If The device is ThingMagic, the port number has to be 8080. EMS has aa default port number 10001, but the port number tha the device uses to listen can be changed. For Matrics, Feig. AWID use the port number that is configured on the Moxa box connected to the reader.

property.label: Host IP Address
property.description: IP Address

property.label: Socket Linger Time
property.description: Enable SocketLinger with the specified linger time in seconds (affects socket close). Integer -1 - MAX (platform specific). Default -1 - disable.

property.label: Keep Alive
property.description: Whether or not to have socket keep alive turned on.

property.label: TCP/IP no delay
property.description: Enables Nagles algorithm, to minimize network traffic through buffering.

entity.label: TCP Client Discovery Data Channel Configuration
entity.description: TCP Client Discovery Data Channel Configuration

property.label: Port number
property.description: IP Port number

property.label: Host discovery name
property.description: IP Address, This field will be used for discovery of the reader

property.label: Socket Linger Time
property.description: Enable SocketLinger with the specified linger time in seconds (affects socket close). Integer -1 - MAX (platform specific). Default -1 - disable.

property.label: Keep Alive
property.description: Whether or not to have socket keep alive turned on.

property.label: TCP/IP no delay
property.description: Enables Nagles algorithm, to minimize network traffic through buffering.

property.label: Port number
property.description: IP Port number. If the device is Alien, port number has to be 23. If The device is ThingMagic, the port number has to be 8080. EMS has aa default port number 10001, but the port number tha the device uses to listen can be changed. For Matrics, Feig. AWID use the port number that is configured on the Moxa box connected to the reader.

property.label: Socket Linger Time
property.description: Enable SocketLinger with the specified linger time in seconds (affects socket close). Integer -1 - MAX (platform specific). Default -1 - disable.

property.label: KeepAlive
property.description: Whether or not to have socket keep alive turned on.

property.label: TCP/IP no delay
property.description: Enables Nagles algorithm, to minimize network traffic through buffering.

property.label: Resource Name
property.description: Resource Name

entity.label: Constraint
entity.description: Resources that can not be scheduled together

property.label: Constraint Name
property.description: Constraint Name

property.label: Constraint Resource Name
property.description: The device node name of this constraint

property.label: Task Name
property.description: Task Name

property.label: Time Between Reads
property.description: Frequency with which the task is executed in ms. Integer between 0 and 1000000000

property.label: Latency Threshold
property.description: Latency Threshold. If task is not executed within LatencyThreshold, its effective priority will increase until it is executed.

property.label: Priority
property.description: Task Priority

property.label: Task Resource Name
property.description: Resource belonging to a task

property.label: Adapter Name
property.description: Task Name

property.label: AdapterType
property.description: Adapter type

entity.label: Write Algorithm
entity.description: component that takes care of the way write operation is executed.

entity.label: Tag Reader Adapter
entity.description: Tag Reader Adapter provides high level abstraction of RF Reader Devices

property.label: Queue Name
property.description: Queue Name where the outputs of this adapter go.

property.label: Enable/Disable the TagReader
property.description: If enabled, the TagReader will start to read data from the reader nodes associated with it. If disabled, the TagReader will stop reading.

entity.label: Notificatoin Adapter
entity.description: Notification Adapter provides high level abstraction of RF Reader Devices

property.label: Queue Name
property.description: Queue Name where the outputs of this adapter go.

property.label: Enable/Disable the TagReader
property.description: If enabled, the TagReader will start to read data from the reader nodes associated with it. If disabled, the TagReader will stop reading.

entity.label: Polling and Notification Adapter
entity.description: Notification Adapter provides high level abstraction of RF Reader Devices

property.label: Queue Name
property.description: Queue Name where the outputs of this adapter go.

property.label: Enable/Disable the TagReader
property.description: If enabled, the TagReader will start to read data from the reader nodes associated with it. If disabled, the TagReader will stop reading.

entity.label: Read Algorithm
entity.description: Read Algorithm is a configurable component that allows to customize the way read operation is executed

property.label: Read from all antennas at once
property.description: If enabled and reader allows reading from multiple nodes at the same time, each read command will be executed from all nodes specified in the TagReader adapter configuration.

property.label: Minimum Reads
property.description: Minimum number of times to read.

property.label: Maximum Reads
property.description: Maximum number of times to read; each read after Minimum Reads satisfied will be executed only if Add/Remove condition is true.

property.label: Minimum Duration
property.description: Minimum amount of time spend reading.

property.label: Maximum Duration
property.description: Maximum amount of time spend reading.

property.label: Minimum Condition
property.description: Determines how number of reads and duration are used.

property.label: Maximum Condition
property.description: Determines how number of reads and duration are used.

property.label: Continue Condition
property.description: Determines how number of reads and duration are used.

property.label: Continue if added tags is greater then
property.description: Continue if number of tags added since last read is greater than this value.

property.label: Stop if removed tags is greater then
property.description: Stop if number of tags removed since last read is greater than this value.

property.label: Is system field
property.description: Detremines wether the read Tag Field is Sytem Field or not.

property.label: Is tag id fragment
property.description: Determines if the read Tag Field is fragment of Tag Id.

property.label: Offset
property.description: Determines offset in user memory to read from in bits.

property.label: Size
property.description: Number of bits to read from Tag user memory.

property.label: Field Name
property.description: Name of the field to be read.

entity.label: Tag Cache Adapter
entity.description: Tag Cache adapter stores RF data from user area of the tags to optimize reading performance.

property.label: Maximum Size
property.description: Limit maximum number of tags that cache can hold. List used items will be removed first.

entity.label: Opc Adapter
entity.description: Adapter used for Opc Server devices.

property.label: Feedback Queue Name
property.description: Name of the EMS queue adapter will use to receive feedback requests.

property.label: DigitalInput Queue Name
property.description: Name of the EMS queue adapter will use to send events from input sources.

property.label: StatusLog Queue Name
property.description: Name of the EMS queue adapter will use to send device status events (ONLINE/OFFLINE).

entity.label: Dio Adapter
entity.description: Adapter used for Digital IO devices.

property.label: Feedback Queue Name
property.description: Name of the EMS queue adapter will use to receive feedback requests.

property.label: DigitalInput Queue Name
property.description: Name of the EMS queue adapter will use to send events from input sources.

property.label: StatusLog Queue Name
property.description: Name of the EMS queue adapter will use to send device status events (ONLINE/OFFLINE).

entity.label: Barcode Scanner Adapter
entity.description: Adapter used for Barcode Scanner devices.

property.label: Queue Name
property.description: Queue Name where the outputs of this adapter goes.

property.label: Reader Name
property.description: The device node name

property.label: Feedback Name
property.description: Name used by Senseware components to refer to this feedback message.

property.label: Feedback Lable
property.description: The same label value can be assigned to 2 or more feedbacks. Application can retrieve all feedbacks with the same label.

property.label: Feedback Type
property.description: Depending on the type feedback will produce blinking, steady on or off signal.

property.label: Point Number
property.description: The point number to be configured as it is set on the SNAP. The maximum is equal to maximum number of point the device supports.

property.label: The state the point is on initially
property.description: For 'blink' feedback type. First output state of the sequence of outputs.

property.label: Output Interval Sequence
property.description: Comma-separated list of non-negative integer values. Each number is the interval of the current output state.

property.label: Minimum Active Time
property.description: Minimum time this feedback must be active. After elapsed feedback time exceeds this value feedback can be aborted to allow execution of next feedback.

property.label: Feedback Name
property.description: Name used by Senseware components to refer to this input source.

property.label: Digital Input Source Lable
property.description: The same label value can be assigned to 2 or more input sources. Application can retrieve all input sources with the same label.

property.label: Input Event Type
property.description: If value is 'On' only Off to On signal changes will be send, including initial 'On'. If initial state is 'Off' no event notification will be sent. 'On and Off' notifies of all input events.

property.label: Point Number
property.description: The point number to be configured as it is set on the SNAP. The maximum is equal to maximum number of point the device supports.

entity.label: Action Description
entity.description: Description of actions to take when a point goes on or off

property.label: Action Name
property.description: Action name

property.label: Polarity on high value
property.description: Polarity on high value

property.label: Initial Delay on ON Action
property.description: The period of time in milliseconds until the next action will be started

property.label: Initial Delay on OFF Action
property.description: The period of time in milliseconds until the next action will be started

property.label: Action
property.description: The action to be taken when to point goes ON

property.label: Action time
property.description: The time that the action taken when the point goes ON should last

property.label: Action
property.description: The action to be taken when to point goes OFF

entity.label: Target
entity.description: The target on which the actions will take place

property.label: Target Name
property.description: The name of the target
